description: A five-slide presentation with key information about Football (Soccer).
title: All About Football (Soccer)

slides.title: Introduction to Football
slides.content: Football, commonly known as soccer in North America, is the world's most popular sport. It's played by two teams of 11 players each, using a spherical ball on a rectangular field with goals at each end. The objective is to score more goals than the opponent within 90 minutes of play.

slides.title: History and Origins
content: Modern football originated in England in the 19th century, with the first set of rules established in 1863.
The world's oldest football competition is the FA Cup, founded in 1871. The sport spread globally through British influence during the colonial era.
The first World Cup was held in 1930 in Uruguay, with only 13 teams participating. Today, FIFA organizes the tournament every four years.

slides.title: Rules and Gameplay
content: Each match lasts 90 minutes, divided into two 45-minute halves with a 15-minute break.
Players cannot use their hands or arms except for the goalkeeper within their penalty area.
Key fouls include tripping, pushing, and dangerous tackles. Yellow and red cards are used for discipline.
Offside rule prevents 'cherry-picking' - players cannot be in an advanced position when the ball is played forward unless they're behind the ball.

slides.title: Famous Players and Records
content: Pelé (Brazil) won three World Cups (1958, 1962, 1970) and is widely considered one of the greatest players ever.
Lionel Messi (Argentina) has won a record 8 Ballon d'Or awards and holds numerous scoring records.
Cristiano Ronaldo (Portugal) is the all-time leading goalscorer in international football with over 120 goals.
The fastest goal in World Cup history was scored by Hakan Şükür of Turkey in 2002, just 11 seconds into the match.

slides.title: Global Impact and Culture
content: Football is played in every country worldwide, with FIFA recognizing 211 national associations.
The sport generates billions in revenue through broadcasting rights, sponsorships, and merchandise.
Major club competitions include the UEFA Champions League in Europe and Copa Libertadores in South America.
Football promotes unity and cultural exchange, with the World Cup being the most watched sporting event globally.
